          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;

    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }

    /* Links that look like buttons. */

    align-items: center;

    text-decoration: none;

  }

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }

    box-sizing: border-box;

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<span class="line"><!---->This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<span class="line"><!---->gfx::Rect window_for_minimum_size) {<span class="line"><!---->    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<!----></span><br>  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<span class="line"><!---->  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<!----></span><br>      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<span class="line"><!---->      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<!----></span><br>          root_window_); // <---- the use [1]<span class="line"><!---->          root_window_); // &lt;---- the use [1]<!----></span><br>  if (snap_position == NONE)<span class="line"><!---->  if (snap_position == NONE)<!----></span><br>    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<span class="line"><!---->    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<!----></span><br><br>  if (window_for_minimum_size && ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (window_for_minimum_size &amp;&amp; ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<!----></span><br>    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size->bounds();<span class="line"><!---->    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size-&gt;bounds();<!----></span><br>    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size->parent(), &bounds);<span class="line"><!---->    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size-&gt;parent(), &amp;bounds);<!----></span><br>    return bounds;<span class="line"><!---->    return bounds;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<span class="line"><!---->AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<!----></span><br> delegate,<span class="line"><!---->    AshWindowTreeHostDelegate* delegate,<!----></span><br>    size_t compositor_memory_limit_mb)<span class="line"><!---->    size_t compositor_memory_limit_mb)<!----></span><br>    : aura::WindowTreeHostPlatform(std::make_unique<aura::Window>(nullptr)),  // <--- UaF [2]<span class="line"><!---->    : aura::WindowTreeHostPlatform(std::make_unique&lt;aura::Window&gt;(nullptr)),  // &lt;--- UaF [2]<!----></span><br>      delegate_(delegate),<span class="line"><!---->      delegate_(delegate),<!----></span><br>      transformer_helper_(this) {<span class="line"><!---->      transformer_helper_(this) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(delegate_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(delegate_);<!----></span><br>  CreateCompositor(/* force_software_compositor */ false,<span class="line"><!---->  CreateCompositor(/* force_software_compositor */ false,<!----></span><br>                   /* use_external_begin_frame_control */ false,<span class="line"><!---->                   /* use_external_begin_frame_control */ false,<!----></span><br>                   /* enable_compositing_based_throttling */ false,<span class="line"><!---->                   /* enable_compositing_based_throttling */ false,<!----></span><br>                   compositor_memory_limit_mb);<span class="line"><!---->                   compositor_memory_limit_mb);<!----></span><br>  SetPlatformWindow(std::move(platform_window));<span class="line"><!---->  SetPlatformWindow(std::move(platform_window));<!----></span><br>  CommonInit();<span class="line"><!---->  CommonInit();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/splitview/split_view_controller.cc;drc=36abfc6cecf36bdb6ee2cbe29e89c9572846861b;l=1048<a class="undefined" target="_blank" <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: Chromium 103.0.5008.0 + Dev<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: Chromium 103.0.5008.0 + Dev<!----></span><br>Operating System: Linux-chromeOS<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Linux-chromeOS<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>(*) Dual display<span class="line"><!---->(*) Dual display<!----></span><br>(*) The testing used tablet mode, but will check in normal mode later.<span class="line"><!---->(*) The testing used tablet mode, but will check in normal mode later.<!----></span><br>(*) Chromium and Lacros tested<span class="line"><!---->(*) Chromium and Lacros tested<!----></span><br><br>(1) Host poc3.html on webserver<span class="line"><!---->(1) Host poc3.html on webserver<!----></span><br>(2) Navigate to localhost:8000/poc3.html<span class="line"><!---->(2) Navigate to localhost:8000/poc3.html<!----></span><br>(3) Move the video on the second display, until shown black border split view<span class="line"><!---->(3) Move the video on the second display, until shown black border split view<!----></span><br>(4) Click on the border then detach second display<span class="line"><!---->(4) Click on the border then detach second display<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==677758==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x6150002ab878 at pc 0x7fb463c2d5a3 bp 0x7ffe0b77f860 sp 0x7ffe0b77f858<span class="line"><!---->==677758==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-use-after-free on address 0x6150002ab878 at pc 0x7fb463c2d5a3 bp 0x7ffe0b77f860 sp 0x7ffe0b77f858<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x6150002ab878 thread T0 (chrome)<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x6150002ab878 thread T0 (chrome)<!----></span><br>SCARINESS: 51 (8-byte-read-heap-use-after-free)<span class="line"><!---->SCARINESS: 51 (8-byte-read-heap-use-after-free)<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7fb463c2d5a2 in operator bool base/memory/raw_ptr.h:807:59<span         oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;

        }

        }

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

      <style>

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)

    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<span class="line"><!---->This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<span class="line"><!---->gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<!----></span><br>    SnapPosition snap_position,<span class="line"><!---->    SnapPosition snap_position,<!----></span><br>    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<span class="line"><!---->    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<!----></span><br>  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<span class="line"><!---->  const         oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        connie@,<span class="line"><!---->connie@,<!----></span><br><br>The repro steps on <span class="line"><!---->The repro steps on <!----></span>comment #0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->comment #0<!----></a> doesn't work anymore after your fixes on <span class="line"><!----> doesn't work anymore after your fixes on <!----></span>issue #1316960<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1316960" title="Security: negative-size-param SnapWindow (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1316960<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> another CL from other developer(see point 2).           <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-unpaid reward-3000
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, we consider attachments/POCs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, we consider attachments/POCs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> so I've undeleted them.<span class="line"><!----> so I've undeleted them.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

            <div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">

      <option value="0" selected="">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<span class="line"><!---->This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the         oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        connie@,<span class="line"><!---->connie@,<!----></span><br><br>The repro steps on <span class="line"><!---->The repro steps on <!----></span>comment #0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->comment #0<!----></a> doesn't work anymore after your fixes on <span class="line"><!----> doesn't work anymore after your fixes on <!----></span>issue #1316960<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1316960" title="Security: negative-size-param SnapWindow (chromeOS)"><!---->issue #1316960<!----></a> and<span class="line"><!----> and<!----></span> another CL from other developer(see point 2). I uploaded new screencast for visibility.<span class="line"><!----> another CL from other developer(see point 2). I uploaded new screencast for visibility.<!----></span><br><br>New repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->New repro steps:<!----></span><br>(1) Navigate to <span class="line"><!---->(1) Navigate to <!----></span>https://rhezashan.github.io/pocs/poc2.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://rhezashan.github.io/pocs/poc2.html"><!---->https://rhezashan.github.io/pocs/poc2.html<!----></a> then select display 2<span class="line"><!----> then select display 2<!----></span><br>(2) wait a seconds (new behavior won't allow snapping window on early time) and then enter overview mode (F5)<span class="line"><!---->(2) wait a seconds (new behavior won't allow snapping window on early time) and then enter overview mode (F5)<!----></span><br>(3) Click on the border on display 2 then detach second display.<span class="line"><!---->(3) Click on the border on display 2 then detach second display.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<span class="line"><!---->This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<span class="line"><!---->gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<!----></span><br>    SnapPosition snap_position,<span class="line"><!---->    SnapPosition snap_position,<!----></span><br>    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<span class="line"><!---->    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<!----></span><br>  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<span class="line"><!---->  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<!----></span><br>      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<span class="line"><!---->      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<!----></span><br>          root_window_); // <---- the use [1]<span class="line"><!---->          root_window_); // &lt;---- the use [1]<!----></span><br>  if (snap_position == NONE)<span class="line"><!---->  if (snap_position == NONE)<!----></span><br>    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<span class="line"><!---->    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<!----></span><br><br>  if (window_for_minimum_size && ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (window_for_minimum_size &amp;&amp; ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<!----></span><br>    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size->bounds();<span class="line"><!---->    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size-&gt;bounds();<!----></span><br>    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size->parent(), &bounds);<span class="line"><!---->    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size-&gt;parent(), &amp;bounds);<!----></span><br>    return bounds;<span class="line"><!---->    return bounds;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<span class="line"><!---->AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<!----></span><br>    std::unique_ptr<ui::PlatformWindow> platform_window,<span class="line"><!---->    std::unique_ptr&lt;ui::PlatformWindow&gt; platform_window,<!----></span><br>    AshWindowTreeHostDelegate* delegate,<span class="line"><!---->    AshWindowTreeHostDelegate* delegate,<!----></span><br>    size_t compositor_memory_limit_mb)<span class="line"><!---->    size_t compositor_memory_limit_mb)<!----></span><br>    : aura::WindowTreeHostPlatform(std::make_unique<aura::Window>(nullptr)),  // <--- UaF [2]<span class="line"><!---->    : aura::WindowTreeHostPlatform(std::make_unique&lt;aura::Window&gt;(nullptr)),  // &lt;--- UaF [2]<!----></span><br>      delegate_(delegate),<span class="line"><!---->      delegate_(delegate),<!----></span><br>      transformer_helper_(this) {<span class="line"><!---->      transformer_helper_(this) {<!----></span><br>  DCHECK(delegate_);<span class="line"><!---->  DCHECK(delegate_);<!----></span><br>  CreateCompositor(/* force_software_compositor */ false,<span class="line"><!---->  CreateCompositor(/* force_software_compositor */ false,<!----></span><br>                   /* use_external_begin_frame_control */ false,<span class="line"><!---->                   /* use_external_begin_frame_control */ false,<!----></span><br>                   /* enable_compositing_based_throttling */ false,<span class="line"><!---->                   /* enable_compositing_based_throttling */ false,<!----></span><br>                   compositor_memory_limit_mb);<span class="line"><!---->                   compositor_memory_limit_mb);<!----></span><br>  SetPlatformWindow(std::move(platform_window));<span class="line"><!---->  SetPlatformWindow(std::move(platform_window));<!----></span><br>  CommonInit();<span class="line"><!---->  CommonInit();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/splitview/split_view_controller.cc;drc=36abfc6cecf36bdb6ee2cbe29e89c9572846861b;l=1048<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/splitview/split_view_controller.cc;drc=36abfc6cecf36bdb6ee2cbe29e89c9572846861b;l=1048"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ash/wm/splitview/split_view_controller.cc;drc=36abfc6cecf36bdb6ee2cbe29e89c9572846861b;l=1048<!----></a><br>[2] class="undefined" target="_blank"         oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided on based on this issue not being remote exploitable and being mitigated by user interaction. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided on based on this issue not being remote exploitable and being mitigated by user interaction. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1.         Hello, we consider attachments/POCs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<span class="line"><!---->Hello, we consider attachments/POCs included with reports to be an integral part of the report (<!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a>),<span class="line"><!---->),<!----></span> so I've undeleted them.<span class="line"><!----> so I've undeleted them.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by rheza...@gmail.com (Apr 16, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<span class="line"><!---->This Heap UaF occurs when the SplitViewController can not find actual size for app when it's moving to another display and the second display were detached.<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<span class="line"><!---->gfx::Rect SplitViewController::GetSnappedWindowBoundsInScreen(<!----></span><br>    SnapPosition snap_position,<span class="line"><!---->    SnapPosition snap_position,<!----></span><br>    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<span class="line"><!---->    aura::Window* window_for_minimum_size) {<!----></span><br>  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<span class="line"><!---->  const gfx::Rect work_area_bounds_in_screen =<!----></span><br>      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<span class="line"><!---->      screen_util::GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInScreenForActiveDeskContainer(<!----></span><br>          root_window_); // <---- the use [1]<span class="line"><!---->          root_window_); // &lt;---- the use [1]<!----></span><br>  if (snap_position == NONE)<span class="line"><!---->  if (snap_position == NONE)<!----></span><br>    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<span class="line"><!---->    return work_area_bounds_in_screen;<!----></span><br><br>  if (window_for_minimum_size && ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<span class="line"><!---->  if (window_for_minimum_size &amp;&amp; ShouldUseWindowBoundsDuringFastResize()) {<!----></span><br>    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size->bounds();<span class="line"><!---->    gfx::Rect bounds = window_for_minimum_size-&gt;bounds();<!----></span><br>    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size->parent(), &bounds);<span class="line"><!---->    wm::ConvertRectToScreen(window_for_minimum_size-&gt;parent(), &amp;bounds);<!----></span><br>    return bounds;<span class="line"><!---->    return bounds;<!----></span><br>  }<span class="line"><!---->  }<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<span class="line"><!---->AshWindowTreeHostPlatform::AshWindowTreeHostPlatform(<!----></span><br>         oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Correction: The title for this issue should "heap-use-after-free on GetDisplayWorkAreaBoundsInParentForActiveDeskContainer ash/screen_util.cc:82:39" not heap-buffer-overflow on ash/host/ash_window_tree_host_platform.cc.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<span class="line"><!---->This issue requires additional review before it can be merged to the LTS channel. Please answer the following questions to help us evaluate this merge:<!----></span><br><br>1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<span class="line"><!---->1. Number of CLs needed for this fix and links to them.<!----></span><br>2. Level of complexity (High, Medium, Low - Explain)<span class="line"><!---->2. Level of complexity (High, Medium, Low - Explain)<!----></span><br>3. Has this been merged to a stable release? beta release?<span class="line"><!---->3.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This particular event happens because SplitViewController tries to do some work in the destructor. <span class="line"><!---->This particular event happens because SplitViewController tries to do some work in the destructor. <!----></span><br>The windows must have already been moved to another displays by that time, so it should either do nothing or cancel the operation and do nothing.<span class="line"><!---->The windows must have already been moved to another displays by that time, so it should either do nothing or cancel the operation and do nothing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          CrashOnDisconnectingSecondDisplay.mov<b><!---->CrashOnDisconnectingSecondDisplay.mov<!----></b>
          
        <div class="filename">
          
          <b><!---->CrashOnDisconnectingSecondDisplay.mov<!----></b>

        oshima@,<span class="line"><!---->oshima@,<!----></span><br><br>sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<span class="line"><!---->sorry for the delay in respond. What connie@ said is correct about " wrote a script which can play the video on the second display". I didn't use mouse in tablet mode. I pass --force-tablet-mode=touch_view --touch-devices=9 --show-taps in command line to simulate touchscreen. You need to to launch chromeOS with dual display then set the display to extended display for second monitor. Normal dual display in tablet mode is mirroring.<!----></span><br><br>I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<span class="line"><!---->I think the future suggestion is disable extended mode in tablet mode.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

while the<span class="line"><!---->This CL fixed the crash on removing the secondary display while the<!----></span><br>divider in it by avoid resizing the split view divider and the snapped<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Congratulations, Rheza! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report. The reward amount was decided on based on this issue not being remote exploitable and being mitigated by user interaction. Thank you for your efforts and reporting this issue to us.<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, Rheza! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report.
